data.title: The 55+ Best Fox Kids Shows
data.meta_description: Over 3K TV viewers have voted on the 55+ Best Fox Kids Shows. Current Top 3: Spider-Man, Batman: The Animated Series, X-Men: The Animated Series
data.text:
Ranked By

46.0K votes

3.3K voters

5 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the shows that aired as part of Fox Kids Programming that you wish were still running new episodes today.

The best Fox Kids shows range from nostalgic cartoons to live-action kids shows. This list of popular Fox Kids TV shows is ranked from best to worst thanks to your votes. This list of the top current and canceled Fox Kids series includes the date when each show first aired. The best Fox Kids programs of all time include old Fox Kids shows, as this list covers shows the entire history of the Fox Kids Network, including when it was a programming block.

These top Fox Kids shows include shows such as X-Men: The Animated Series, Bobby's World, Animaniacs, and Inspector Gadget.

Although people in different locations grew up with Fox Kids shows on different channels (especially those of us in the States), most of us got the same shows, so don't let your favorite Fox Kids shows sink to the bottom of the list! Vote up the best Fox Kids shows, or use this list to build a whole new one just like it, then re-rank it to fit your opinion.

Most divisive: Godzilla: The Series

Over 3.3K Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 55+ Best Fox Kids Shows

Christopher Daniel Barnes, Jennifer Hale, Ed Asner

1,713 votes

Premiered : September 10, 1994

Network : FOX

In Spider-Man, the iconic superhero swung into the hearts of children and adults alike as one of Fox Kids' most popular and enduring animated series. With its blend of action, humor, and drama, this show managed to captivate audiences by delving into not only the web-slinging heroics of Spider-Man but also the relatable struggles of his alter ego, Peter Parker. The series tackled important themes such as responsibility, friendship, and acceptance, making it a family-friendly choice that both entertained and educated viewers on how to handle real-life situations with grace and courage.

Kevin Conroy, Efrem Zimbalist, Bob Hastings

1,794 votes

Premiered : September 5, 1992

Network : FOX

Batman: The Animated Series stands as a prime example of how a show can maintain a sophisticated, noir atmosphere while remaining family-friendly and engaging for younger audiences. This groundbreaking series introduced a new generation to the Dark Knight while remaining true to his comic book roots, exploring complex themes such as justice, redemption, and the consequences of one's actions. The well-developed characters and thoughtful storytelling approach allowed the show to address mature topics in a manner accessible to a wide range of ages, solidifying its status as one of Fox Kids' shining stars.

Cal Dodd, Cedric Smith, Norm Spencer

1,825 votes

Premiered : October 31, 1992

Network : FOX

X-Men: The Animated Series perfectly captured the essence of the beloved comic book series and translated it into a thrilling, family-friendly TV show that pushed the boundaries of children's animation. Delving into themes like acceptance, prejudice, and teamwork, the series showcased a diverse group of mutant heroes who faced challenges both superhuman and personal. The show presented complex and relatable storylines that resonated with audiences, cleverly using the metaphor of mutant powers to teach valuable life lessons while delivering high-octane action and adventure synonymous with Fox Kids programming.

Austin St. John, Jason David Frank, David Yost

1,498 votes

Premiered : August 28, 1993

Network : FOX

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers is more than just a TV show; it's a cultural phenomenon that took the world by storm with its colorful costumes, epic battles, and unforgettable catchphrases. The show's formula of ordinary teenagers transforming into superheroes to battle evil resonated with young audiences and provided them with valuable life lessons, such as teamwork, perseverance, and responsibility. Power Rangers' unique combination of live-action, special effects, and martial arts elevated it to iconic status in the world of children's entertainment and solidified its place as one of the best Fox Kids shows ever made.

Rob Paulsen, Tress MacNeille, Jess Harnell

1,350 votes

Premiered : September 13, 1993

Network : FOX

Animaniacs brought a refreshing mix of humor, music, and educational content to Fox Kids programming, earning its spot as one of the network's most beloved animated series. With zany characters like Yakko, Wakko, and Dot at the forefront, the show delivered on its promise to entertain audiences with fast-paced, slapstick comedy while also sneaking in clever educational segments, such as Yakko's famous "Nations of the World" song. The show's writers expertly balanced wacky antics with valuable life lessons, making Animaniacs a perfect choice for family-friendly, informative, and entertaining television.

Premiered : September 14, 1990

Network : FOX

Tiny Toon Adventures invited a new generation of viewers to experience the hilarity and heart of the classic Looney Tunes characters in a fresh and innovative setting. The show featured numerous young, up-and-coming toons learning from their wise, experienced mentors, which provided an engaging platform to teach important themes such as friendship, perseverance, and the power of imagination. With its catchy theme song and lovable cast of characters, Tiny Toon Adventures captured the essence of what made the original Looney Tunes so beloved while carving out its unique place in the pantheon of Fox Kids programming.
